title: Construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza
description: Built as a tomb for the Pharaoh Khufu during Egypt's Fourth Dynasty, the Great Pyramid is the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

title: Magna Carta is sealed
description: King John of England affixed his seal to the Magna Carta at Runnymede, establishing principles that limited royal authority and influenced constitutional law.

title: First Moon landing (Apollo 11)
description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the Moon, marking a milestone in space exploration.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: The opening of the border between East and West Berlin symbolized the end of the Cold War and led to German reunification.

title: The World Wide Web becomes publicly available
description: Tim Berners-Lee opened the World Wide Web to the public, enabling the modern internet as we know it.

title: Human Genome Project completed
description: An international research effort successfully mapped and sequenced the human genome, transforming biology and medicine.

title: Code of Hammurabi created
description: One of the oldest deciphered writings of significant length, this Babylonian code of law established standards for commercial interactions and set fines and punishments.

title: Traditional date of the Trojan War
description: The legendary conflict between the kingdoms of Troy and Mycenaean Greece, immortalized in Homer's epic poems.

title: First Olympic Games held
description: The ancient Olympic Games began in Olympia, Greece, establishing a tradition of athletic competition that continues today.

title: Founding of Rome
description: According to legend, Romulus founded the city of Rome, which would grow to become one of history's greatest empires.

title: Buddha achieves enlightenment
description: Siddhartha Gautama attained enlightenment under the Bodhi tree, becoming the Buddha and founding Buddhism.

title: Democracy established in Athens
description: Cleisthenes introduced reforms that created the world's first known democracy in Athens.

title: Battle of Marathon
description: Athens defeated the Persian invasion at Marathon, preserving Greek independence and inspiring the marathon race.

title: Construction of the Parthenon begins
description: Athens began building the Parthenon, a temple dedicated to Athena that represents the pinnacle of ancient Greek architecture.

title: Death of Socrates
description: The philosopher Socrates was executed in Athens, becoming a martyr for free thought and philosophical inquiry.

title: Alexander the Great begins his conquests
description: Alexander embarked on his campaign to create one of the largest empires in history, spreading Greek culture across three continents.

title: Construction of the Great Wall of China begins
description: Emperor Qin Shi Huang ordered the connection and extension of defensive walls, creating the foundation of the Great Wall.

title: Assassination of Julius Caesar
description: Julius Caesar was assassinated by Roman senators, an event that marked the end of the Roman Republic and the rise of the Roman Empire.

title: Birth of Jesus Christ
description: The birth of Jesus of Nazareth, whose teachings formed the basis of Christianity, one of the world's major religions.

title: Crucifixion of Jesus Christ
description: The crucifixion and reported resurrection of Jesus became the central event of Christian faith.

title: Eruption of Mount Vesuvius destroys Pompeii
description: The volcanic eruption buried the Roman cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum, preserving them for archaeological study.

title: Constantine converts to Christianity
description: Emperor Constantine's conversion marked the beginning of Christianity's transformation into the dominant religion of the Roman Empire.

title: Fall of the Western Roman Empire
description: The deposition of Romulus Augustulus marked the end of the Western Roman Empire and the beginning of the Middle Ages in Europe.

title: Muhammad's revelation and founding of Islam
description: Muhammad received his first revelation, marking the beginning of Islam, which would become one of the world's major religions.

title: Charlemagne crowned Holy Roman Emperor
description: Pope Leo III crowned Charlemagne, uniting much of Western Europe and establishing the Holy Roman Empire.

title: Battle of Hastings
description: William the Conqueror defeated King Harold II, leading to the Norman conquest of England and transforming English culture.

title: First Crusade begins
description: Pope Urban II launched the First Crusade to recapture Jerusalem, beginning centuries of conflict between Christian and Muslim powers.

title: Genghis Khan establishes the Mongol Empire
description: Genghis Khan united the Mongol tribes and began building the largest contiguous land empire in history.

title: Black Death reaches Europe
description: The bubonic plague arrived in Europe, killing an estimated one-third of the continent's population and transforming society.

title: Fall of Constantinople
description: The Ottoman Empire conquered Constantinople, ending the Byzantine Empire and marking a major shift in European and Middle Eastern power.

title: Johannes Gutenberg invents the printing press
description: Gutenberg's movable-type printing press revolutionized the spread of information, literacy, and ideas across Europe.

title: Christopher Columbus reaches the Americas
description: Columbus's first voyage across the Atlantic led to sustained European contact with the Americas.

title: Vasco da Gama reaches India
description: Da Gama's voyage established a sea route from Europe to India, opening direct trade between Europe and Asia.

title: Martin Luther posts the Ninety-five Theses
description: Luther's theses criticized certain practices of the Catholic Church and catalyzed the Protestant Reformation.

title: Spanish conquest of the Aztec Empire
description: Hernán Cortés conquered the Aztec Empire, dramatically altering the course of Mexican and Latin American history.

title: Copernicus publishes heliocentric theory
description: Nicolaus Copernicus published his theory that the Earth orbits the Sun, revolutionizing astronomy and science.

title: Spanish Armada defeated
description: England defeated the Spanish Armada, establishing English naval dominance and beginning Spain's decline as a world power.

title: Jamestown founded
description: The first permanent English settlement in North America was established in Virginia.

title: Galileo observes moons of Jupiter
description: Galileo's telescopic observations provided evidence for the Copernican system and transformed astronomy.

title: Mayflower lands at Plymouth Rock
description: The Pilgrims arrived in Massachusetts, establishing Plymouth Colony and influencing American culture and values.

title: English Civil War begins
description: Conflict erupted between Parliamentarians and Royalists, leading to the execution of King Charles I and temporary abolition of the monarchy.

title: Isaac Newton publishes Principia Mathematica
description: Newton's work laid the foundations of classical mechanics and revolutionized mathematics and physics.

title: Peter the Great founds St. Petersburg
description: Russia's new capital symbolized Peter's modernization efforts and opened Russia to Western European influence.

title: Declaration of Independence
description: The Thirteen Colonies declared independence from Great Britain, forming the United States of America.

title: James Watt patents the steam engine
description: Watt's improved steam engine became the driving force of the Industrial Revolution.

title: French Revolution begins
description: The French Revolution dramatically transformed French society and politics, influencing modern democratic movements.

title: Napoleon crowned Emperor of France
description: Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself emperor, beginning a period of French dominance in Europe.

title: Battle of Waterloo
description: Napoleon's final defeat at Waterloo ended the Napoleonic Wars and reshaped European politics for a century.

title: First photograph taken
description: Joseph Nicéphore Niépce created the first permanent photograph, revolutionizing visual communication.

title: Charles Darwin publishes On the Origin of Species
description: Darwin's theory of evolution by natural selection transformed biology and our understanding of life on Earth.

title: American Civil War begins
description: The conflict between Union and Confederate states began, ultimately ending slavery and preserving the United States.

title: Emancipation Proclamation issued
description: President Lincoln declared freedom for slaves in Confederate states, transforming the Civil War into a fight for human freedom.

title: Alexander Graham Bell invents the telephone
description: Bell's invention revolutionized long-distance communication and laid the groundwork for modern telecommunications.

title: Thomas Edison invents the light bulb
description: Edison's practical incandescent light bulb transformed daily life and enabled the modern electric age.

title: Statue of Liberty dedicated
description: France's gift to the United States became an enduring symbol of freedom and democracy.

title: Eiffel Tower completed
description: Gustave Eiffel's iron tower became an iconic symbol of Paris and a marvel of engineering.

title: First modern Olympic Games held
description: The Olympics were revived in Athens, establishing a tradition of international athletic competition.

title: First powered flight
description: The Wright brothers achieved the first controlled, sustained flight of a powered, heavier-than-air aircraft at Kitty Hawk.

title: Einstein publishes theory of relativity
description: Albert Einstein's special theory of relativity revolutionized physics and our understanding of space and time.

title: Ford introduces Model T
description: Henry Ford's affordable automobile revolutionized transportation and manufacturing through assembly line production.

title: Titanic sinks
description: The supposedly unsinkable ship struck an iceberg and sank, killing over 1,500 people in one of history's deadliest maritime disasters.

title: World War I begins
description: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand triggered a global conflict that would reshape the world order.

title: Russian Revolution
description: The Bolshevik Revolution overthrew the Russian government, establishing the first communist state.

title: Treaty of Versailles signed
description: The treaty officially ended World War I but imposed harsh terms on Germany that would contribute to World War II.

title: Women's suffrage in the United States
description: The 19th Amendment granted American women the right to vote, marking a major victory for the women's rights movement.

title: Discovery of penicillin
description: Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin, the first true antibiotic, revolutionizing medicine and saving millions of lives.

title: Stock market crash and Great Depression
description: The Wall Street crash triggered a worldwide economic depression that lasted throughout the 1930s.

title: Hitler becomes Chancellor of Germany
description: Adolf Hitler's rise to power marked the beginning of Nazi Germany and set the stage for World War II.

title: World War II begins
description: Germany's invasion of Poland triggered the deadliest conflict in human history.

title: Attack on Pearl Harbor
description: Japan's surprise attack brought the United States into World War II and changed the course of the war.

title: D-Day invasion
description: Allied forces launched the largest amphibious invasion in history, beginning the liberation of Western Europe from Nazi occupation.

title: Atomic bombs dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki
description: The United States dropped atomic bombs on two Japanese cities, ending World War II and beginning the nuclear age.

title: United Nations founded
description: The UN was established to promote international cooperation and prevent future world wars.

title: India gains independence
description: India achieved independence from British rule, marking the beginning of decolonization across Asia and Africa.

title: State of Israel established
description: The declaration of Israeli independence created a Jewish state and triggered ongoing Middle Eastern conflicts.

title: NATO formed
description: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization was created as a collective defense alliance during the Cold War.

title: People's Republic of China established
description: Mao Zedong proclaimed the founding of communist China after defeating nationalist forces.

title: Korean War begins
description: North Korea invaded South Korea, drawing in major powers and establishing a pattern for Cold War proxy conflicts.

title: DNA structure discovered
description: Watson and Crick determined the double helix structure of DNA, revolutionizing biology and medicine.
